author: James Joyce
text: Dear Colm The following letter came yesterday from Mr Boon: —We have carefully read your book and we are sorry we are not sufficiently interested in it to make an offer for its publication. We think that it is a book which might or might not give a certain amount of offence to readers and while its merits are undoubtedly very high we should not, as a firm, care to issue it in book form.— Allow me however to thank you for your kind intervention with the firm on behalf of my poor stories. Sincerely yours James Joyce
